documentContentReferences.name: SoA Reference in Amendment Summary
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from the Amendment Summary of Changes table to Table 1 in the Schedule of Activities.

documentContentReferences.name: Screening Procedures Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from the Amendment Summary of Changes table to Section 8 for details on procedures at US screening sites.

documentContentReferences.name: COVID-19 Vaccine Risk Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 2.3.1.1 to Section 10.5 for potential risks and mitigation measures due to COVID-19 vaccine.

documentContentReferences.name: Dose Modification for Risk Mitigation
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Table 3 to Section 6.6 for dose modification or discontinuation as a risk mitigation strategy.

documentContentReferences.name: Investigator's Brochure Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Table 3 to the Investigator's Brochure (IB) for data supporting risk assessment.

documentContentReferences.name: Adaptive Design Features Table
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 4.1 to Table 4, which describes adaptive design features.

documentContentReferences.name: Dose Modification Criteria Table
documentContentReferences.sectionTitle: ALXN1840 Dose Modifications for Individual Participants
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Table 4 to Table 7 for dose modification criteria.

documentContentReferences.name: Exclusion Criteria for Blood Donation
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Table 5 (Lifestyle Considerations) to Section 5.2 regarding blood donation restrictions.

documentContentReferences.name: Contraceptive Guidance Reference
documentContentReferences.sectionTitle: Contraceptive Guidance and Collection of Pregnancy Information
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Table 5 (Lifestyle Considerations) to Section 10.4 for details on appropriate contraceptive methods.

documentContentReferences.name: Inclusion Criteria for Contraception
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Table 5 (Lifestyle Considerations) to Section 5.1 for contraception start time requirements.

documentContentReferences.name: SoA for Intervention Discontinuation
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 7.1 to the SoA for data collection procedures upon discontinuation of study intervention.

documentContentReferences.name: Dose Modification for Discontinuation
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 7.1 to dose modification criteria for discontinuing intervention due to abnormal liver function.

documentContentReferences.name: Pregnancy Discontinuation Criteria
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 7.1 to the pregnancy section as a reason for study intervention discontinuation.

documentContentReferences.name: SoA for Participant Withdrawal
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 7.2 to the SoA for procedures upon participant withdrawal from the study.

documentContentReferences.name: QTc Withdrawal Criteria
documentContentReferences.sectionTitle: DISCONTINUATION OF STUDY INTERVENTION AND PARTICIPANT DISCONTINUATION/WITHDRAWAL
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 8.2.3 to Section 7 for QTc withdrawal criteria.

documentContentReferences.name: Clinical Laboratory Tests List
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 8.2.4 to Section 10.2 for the list of clinical laboratory tests to be performed.

documentContentReferences.name: AE/SAE Reporting Procedures
documentContentReferences.sectionTitle: Adverse Events: Definitions and Procedures for Recording, Evaluating, Follow-up, and Reporting
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 8.3 to Section 10.3 for procedures on recording, evaluating, and reporting AEs and SAEs.

documentContentReferences.name: Lost to Follow-up Definition
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 8.3.3 to Section 7.3 for the definition of 'lost to follow-up'.

documentContentReferences.name: Genetics Section Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 8.3.6 to Section 8.7 to clarify that samples will not be used for genetic testing.

documentContentReferences.name: SoA for PK Sampling
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 8.5 to the SoA (Table 1) for the schedule of pharmacokinetic sample collection.

documentContentReferences.name: Molybdenum Measurement Details
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 8.5 to Section 8.1.1 for details on molybdenum measurement in food, drinks, urine, and feces.

documentContentReferences.name: SoA for PD Sampling
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 8.6 to the SoA (Table 1) for the schedule of pharmacodynamic sample collection.

documentContentReferences.name: Biomarker Details Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 8.8 to Section 8.6 for details on pharmacodynamic biomarkers.

documentContentReferences.name: Analysis Populations Table
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 9.3 to Table 8, which defines the populations for analyses.

commentAnnotations.text: This amendment is considered to be substantial based on the criteria set forth in Article 10(a) of Directive 2001/20/EC of the European Parliament and the Council of the European Union, the US Food and Drug Administration’s (FDA) regulation at 21 CFR part 312.30(b), and any applicable local regulations.
commentAnnotations.sourceSection: PROTOCOL AMENDMENT SUMMARY OF CHANGES TABLE

commentAnnotations.text: The main reason for preparation of this amendment was to clarify study procedures occurring across different sites in the US, so as to facilitate participant recruitment across different regions of the US, and to lessen inconvenience for participants without compromising the quality of the study.
commentAnnotations.sourceSection: PROTOCOL AMENDMENT SUMMARY OF CHANGES TABLE

commentAnnotations.text: Abbreviations: ALT = alanine aminotransferase; AST = aspartate aminotransferase; IB = Investigator’s Brochure; PK = pharmacokinetics; WD = Wilson disease.
commentAnnotations.sourceSection: Table 3: Potential Risks and Mitigation Strategy

commentAnnotations.text: Abbreviations: CRF = case report form; CRU = clinical research unit; EOS = End of Study; SoA = Schedule of Activities.
Abbreviations: ICF = informed consent form; PD = pharmacodynamic; PK = pharmacokinetic.

Note: total molybdenum and PUF molybdenum concentration-time profiles on Day 28 after the last 15 mg ALXN1840 dose will be extrapolated to Day 29 (0-24 hr) and subtracted from the observed Day 29 concentration-time profiles after the first 30 mg

studyDefinitionDocumentVersions.description: Current protocol version as of document date.
